meanings.sent1: The losel never bothered to help anyone in need.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a losel and always strive to do your best.
meanings.sent3: The losel thought it was a great idea to skip work and play video games all day.
meanings.sent4: He was a true losel, always looking for shortcuts instead of working hard.
meanings.sent5: The town regarded him as a losel, someone who brought no value to the community.

meanings.definition: To be a failure or suffer a loss.
meanings.sent1: She feared she would losel her job if she didn't improve her performance.
meanings.sent2: If you don't study for the test, you might losel valuable marks.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to losel the game gracefully, accepting defeat with dignity.
meanings.sent4: He felt like he would losel a part of himself if he gave up on his dream.
meanings.sent5: The company might losel its reputation if it doesn't address the customer complaints.
